question.text: For the equilibrium <math><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>.</mo><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇌</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>;</mo></math> <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> at <math><mn>37</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> . A 5 L vessel contains 0.1 mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>.</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> . How many mole of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> should be added to the flask at this temperature derive the backward reaction for completion? (use R = 0.082 atm-L/mol K)

solution.text:
LiCl.3NH3(s)-0.1⇌LiCl.NH3(s)0.1-+2NH3(g)aa-0.2
KP=9=PNH32
PNH3=3
PV = nRT
3×5=(a-0.2)0.082×310
a=0.79
